oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cassava (Manihot esculenta Crantz) genetic resources: a case of high iron and zinc
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nassar, N.M.A.
Souza Barbosa, I.
Haridassan, M.
Ortiz, R.
Gomes, P.T.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Interspecific hybrids
Iron
leaf
Manihot esculenta
Root
Zinc
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cassava hybrids from interspecific crosses with Manihot caerulescens Pohl, M. pseudoglaziovii Pax and Hoffmann and M. dichotoma Ule showed a very high iron and zinc content in both roots and leaves, e.g. 98.15 mg kg−1 in roots of the interspecific hybrid cassava-M. caerulescens versus 12.17 mg kg−1 in a cassava cultivar. This promising results show the potential of wild Manihot species for micronutrient enhancement of cassava.
